image.altText: A woman in a black top sits on her couch

props.synopsis: Territorians are copping rent rises as high as 60 per cent while some are finding themselves on the street due to no-fault evictions and a lack of options for those doing it tough.

title.children: No-fault evictions leave NT renters at risk of homelessness

image.altText: two police officers walking down a deserted street from behind

props.synopsis: Police say a 33-year-old woman was asleep at home with her two-year-old child when she was violently assaulted by a man armed with a blunt weapon.

title.children: Another child exposed to domestic violence in Alice Springs

image.altText: Children play in Ngukurr's public pool

props.synopsis: For those living in northern Australia, local pools are a part of everyday life. But for remote councils, the costs of keeping a pool up and running can be crippling, leaving some communities without a safe place to swim.

title.children: Calls for safe place to swim as community fears fatal croc attack

image.altText: The sanctuary's homestead pictured ontop of a hill in the middle of the bush.

props.synopsis: In the Northern Territory outback, Wongalara sanctuary is successfully reducing wildfires and lowering pest numbers using strategic burns.

title.children: Remote Wongalara sanctuary using fire to protect native wildlife

image.altText: A burning boat.

props.synopsis: More than 2,000 illegal foreign fishing boats have been picked up in Australian waters over the past decade, but the boats keep coming.

title.children: Why are so many illegal fishing vessels targeting Australia's northern coast?

image.altText: Prince Andrew stands outside Westminster Abbey at the thanksgiving service for Prince Philip.

props.synopsis: Yang Tengbo denies he is a spy and says he is a victim of a changing political landscape between the UK and China.

title.children: Alleged Chinese spy with links to Prince Andrew named

image.altText: A picture of a sunny resort in Fiji

props.synopsis: Investigations and toxicology tests are ongoing in Fiji after four Australian women who drank cocktails at a local resort were hospitalised.

title.children: Family holiday becomes 'worst nightmare' after Fiji alcohol poisoning

image.altText: Donald Trump points as he stands in front of a gold-gilded wall and an American flag.

props.synopsis: In a wide-ranging Q&A with the press in Florida, the president-elect talks about topics ranging from the Middle East to the future of TikTok.

title.children: Five takeaways from Trump's first post-election press conference

image.altText: Two women standing next to a marine corps captain in uniform.

props.synopsis: The US government is racing to find American journalist Austin Tice in Syria after the fall of the Assad regime more than a week ago. His family believe he is a "high-value" prisoner who has been kept alive after 12 years of imprisonment.

title.children: 'High-value prisoner': The 12-year fight to find an American captured in Syria

image.altText: A woman wearing a black head covering with tears in her eyes

props.synopsis: More than 1 million Syrian refugees poured over the border into Lebanon during the country’s horrific civil war, and many are now considering returning.

title.children: Uncertainty for Syrian refugees waiting for safe return after Assad's fall

image.altText: Vladimir Putin (R) and Bashar al-Assad stand at an airbase on a bright clear day.

props.synopsis: In a post on Telegram, an account belonging to the ousted president insists he remained in Damascus until rebel fighters arrived in the city, and then moved to a Russian air base further north, which was then evacuated to Moscow by Russian officials.

title.children: Assad denies planning to flee Syria in first comments from Moscow

image.altText: A photo of Roger Hearn in Gaza standing outside a building with blue arabic writing.

props.synopsis: As director of relief, Roger Hearn was responsible for organising the distribution of food from aid trucks coming in through the border. But what depressed him the most was being unable to bring in enough food to help feed Gaza's 1.9 million internally displaced people.

title.children: Australian UNRWA head saw 'dystopian disaster' of starving kids in Gaza

image.altText: Dozens of tree logs surrounding a large harvesting machine

props.synopsis: The NSW native logging industry is not "economically viable" and the state government should consider shutting it down after 2028 if its prospects do not improve, an independent economic regulator has recommended.

title.children: NSW's native forest logging industry ruled not 'economically viable'

image.altText: Marked and unmarked police cars on a street

props.synopsis: A shooting at a private Christian school in the US state of Wisconsin leaves three people dead, including a child who caused the attack, according to authorities.

title.children: Three dead including shooter in Wisconsin school attack

image.altText: Corporate grey office building and ABC logo

props.synopsis: In addition to increasing funding for the ABC, Labor says it will seek to legislate five-year funding terms for the ABC and SBS to help prevent "political interference".

title.children: Government announces $40m a year funding boost for ABC

image.altText: A graphic of a house that is similar to a dolls house with a for sale sign out the front

props.synopsis: Are you affected by the housing crisis in Australia? The issue could be pivotal in next year's federal election and ABC News is asking you to share your housing story.

title.children: We want to hear how Australia's housing crisis has impacted you. Share your story

image.altText: Photo of a machine spreading human waste.

props.synopsis: A Sydney Water document reveals sewage by-products used in food production contain elevated levels of PFAS.

title.children: Sewage by-products used on farms contaminated with 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: Australia captain Pat Cummins grimaces as he walks off in the rain during a Test.

props.synopsis: Frustration was the emotion of the day as Australia's best attempts to take control of the third Test at the Gabba were spoiled time and again by the most annoying rain possible.

title.children: Australia frustrated by rain, the only thing that can save India

image.altText: An image of Scott Rush, Matthew Norman, Chen Si-Yi, Martin Stephens, and Michael Czugaj

props.synopsis: The Melbourne pastor who has ministered to the Bali Nine members for many years expresses her gratitude to the Indonesian president for allowing the remaining five men to return to Australia.

title.children: Australian pastor 'relieved' remaining Bali Nine members back in Australia

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX is looking to break a five-session losing streak as Wall Street resumes its rally. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set for flat opening

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Nasdaq and Bitcoin accelerate to new records, ASX stuck in neutral

image.altText: Jacinta Allan and Tim Pallas walk in front of cameras

props.synopsis: As Victoria's Treasurer Tim Pallas steps down after a decade in the job, economists say he leaves a legacy of increased infrastructure spending and a tough task for his successor, who is yet to be announced.

title.children: Victoria's next treasurer faces 'challenging' decisions, economists say

image.altText: Moira Deeming appears serious as she walks through the parliament carpark, wearing a purple blazer.

props.synopsis: A group of Victorian Liberal MPs are a pushing to bring ousted MP Moira Deeming back into the party room following her Federal Court victory against party leader John Pesutto.

title.children: Liberal MPs call for vote on reinstating Moira Deeming to party room

image.altText: A blonde woman throwing a yellow banana milkshake in the face of Nigel Farage standing in a group of people

props.synopsis: Victoria Thomas Bowen, 25, was seen throwing a large milkshake over the politician during this year's UK election campaign.

title.children: Woman who threw milkshake at Nigel Farage handed jail sentence

image.altText: A teenage girl in school uniform stands with her arm around an elderly lady.

props.synopsis: Denise Walker started teaching in the 1960s, while also blazing the way as a female pilot in regional NSW. Her students say she brings joy to the classroom.

title.children: 83yo teacher signs on for another year after six decades in the job

image.altText: An artist's impression showing Europa Clipper nearing Jupiter.

props.synopsis: A team at the Canberra Deep Space Communication Complex is tasked with making "first contact" with NASA's largest and most expensive spacecraft, the Europa Clipper, on its journey to Jupiter's fourth-largest moon.

title.children: Deep space experts tracking NASA mission to Jupiter's fourth-largest moon

image.altText: A campaign poster

props.synopsis: Child sexual abuse survivors will meet with Queensland's attorney-general to discuss scrapping good character references for convicted sex offenders in the state's legal system.

title.children: Campaign to ban character references for sex offenders comes to Queensland

image.altText: KI desal plant 2

props.synopsis: The desalination plant is meant to service American Beach, Baudin Beach, Island Beach and Sapphiretown, but some people in those areas have been told they cannot be connected.

title.children: New $150m Kangaroo Island desal plant unable to connect to all households

image.altText: Ash Centra holding her Collingwood gurnsey, next to a pair of members of the Collingwood club

props.synopsis: Midfield prodigy Ash Centra headlines the first AFLW national draft, taken as the number one pick by Collingwood.

title.children: 'I didn't believe it': New crop of AFLW talent taken in first national draft

image.altText: A police vehicle with bushland and smoke in the background

props.synopsis: Fire crews are continuing to battle a blaze at Creswick in central Victoria, but the threat to communities has eased.

title.children: Firefighters battle to bring blaze under control north of Ballarat

image.altText: Next to a very large, brightly coloured mural painting, a woman with brown hair and wearing art smock, stands holds paintbrush.

props.synopsis: A Victorian studio for artists with disabilities is celebrating five decades with its first survey exhibition at TarraWarra Museum of Art.

title.children: Artists with intellectual disabilities celebrate 50 years creating together

image.altText: A close-up of the blades of a windmill, standing over a dirt path and some lakes.

props.synopsis: The SA government has proposed to use a site in Gillman to store and process spoil from a major transport project, but an environmental group says those plans may have major adverse effects on crucial wetlands nearby.

title.children: Environmentalists raise concerns Gillman proposal will put wetlands at risk

image.altText: A pen full of merino sheep with one looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Australia is a leading wool producer globally, but a new report predicts production will reach its lowest level in more than a century by mid-2025.

title.children: Australian wool production forecast to hit 100-year low

image.altText: Two men dressed in black walk across a road. A cloud of smoke comes out of one of the men's mouths.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old WA man who was filmed laughing as he sped towards calves at a property near Geraldton has been sentenced.

title.children: Driver jailed for running over calves in 'sadistic' act of animal cruelty

image.altText: Cheryl Willie with husband Terry and their Christmas-themed tractor display.

props.synopsis: Santa's sleigh being pulled by dirt bikes. Santa on a tractor. Santa sitting on a dunny, with an elf alongside. The roadside Christmas displays in this very out-of-the-way town are worth the trip.

title.children: Tiny Tassie town puts itself 'on the map' with festive displays
